page.title: 07CHICHESTER-SHOPPING SURVEY.
page.content:
The shopping survey was carried out on June 28th 1985 to discover people's views about doing their weekly food shopping in Chichester and the impact of the new {Sainsbury's Superstore.} The results were as follows: {70%}shopped in Chichester{ {50%}travelled by car {47%}shopped in Sainsbury's {58%}of shoppers lived in Chichester
Shoppers came mainly from Chichester and the surrounding area but included tourists from the United Kingdom and abroad. {53%}would use the new Superstore {25%}would not use the new Superstore {67%}felt the store would be of benefit
Reservations were expressed about the distance of the store from the city, but there would be no parking problem.
